newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: QCT says lower costs to aid profits.
newsitem.headline: QCT says lower costs to aid profits.

text.p: Coal miner QCT resources Ltd said on Wednesday that expected improvements in cost performance and the commencement of longwall production at its new Crinum and Kenmare mines in Queensland was expected to improve profitability in 1996/97 and later years.
The company earlier reported a more than doubled year net profit of A$71.47 million, citing higher US$ selling prices and higher sales volumes as reasons for the sharply higher profit.
Partly offsetting these factors were higher unit costs, a higher average value of the Australian dollar and a higher rate of income tax, the company said.
QCT said demand for thermal coal continued to grow more strongly than demand for coking coal, with the increased thermal coal demand requiring further increases in global supply in the near term.
